text.section:
A witness or a person believing he may be called as a witness in any official proceeding is guilty of bribe receiving by a witness when he solicits, accepts or agrees to accept any pecuniary benefit upon an agreement or understanding that:
His testimony will thereby be influenced; or
He will attempt to avoid legal process summoning him to testify; or
He will attempt to absent himself from an official proceeding to which he has been legally summoned.
Bribe receiving by a witness is a Class D felony.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 202, effective January 1, 1975.
